summary: Speed up security: small clear bag, no glass and liquid limits. Power banks are usually OK; selfie sticks aren’t. Policies vary — always check the venue website.

steps.heading: What speeds up entry
steps.body:
- Security focuses on bag contents and prohibited items.
- A few simple tweaks save minutes (and nerves) before you reach the turnstiles.

steps.heading: Small clear bag = faster screening
steps.body:
- A transparent bag makes visual checks easier — some venues even have dedicated lanes.
- Pack light and keep small items in a clear pouch.

steps.heading: No glass; liquid limits apply
steps.body:
- Glass bottles are commonly banned.
- Liquid rules differ — sealed plastic only or none at all.
- Avoid pouring at the gate; buy drinks inside instead.

steps.heading: Power banks usually OK; no selfie sticks
steps.body:
- Small power banks are generally fine, but selfie sticks, tripods and long poles are often prohibited.
- Check in advance to avoid coat-check surprises.
steps.alt: Power bank and selfie stick icon

steps.heading: Policies vary — check the venue site
steps.body:
- Each stadium has its own A–Z guide of allowed/forbidden items.
- A quick look prevents being turned away or binning stuff at the door.

title: Get in faster at the stadium
